CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 11, 1969, pg. 6, reads: "Baptism In River - The Rev. James M. Allen, vested pastor of Calvary Baptist Church, 2629 Wylie Ave., climaxed the "Old Fashioned" Revival Meeting, which he conducted at his church recently, by having baptismal rites in the Allegheny River, following the pattern of the yesteryears. Pastor Allen is seen as he immersed the unidentified candidate.  He is assisted on the left by Deacon Henry Robinson, while Deacon Clinton Robinson, chairman of the board, stands by at the left. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Calvary Baptist Church Deacon Clinton Robinson, Deacon Henry Robinson, and Rev. James M. Allen, baptizing man in Allegheny River, possibly with Jim Davis observing on left
